#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Boston/Outer Neighborhoods
#Text=The Outer Neighborhoods of Boston are four distinct neighborhoods that have been consolidated here for the visitor .
#Text=These areas are a bit further from the city center and can take a little planning to investigate , but gems abound for the adventurous !
#Text=Many Bostonians prize the residences in these areas for their suburban feel while remaining within city limits .
#Text=Hyde Park
#Text=The southernmost neighborhood of Boston , Hyde Park is home to a diverse range of people , housing types and social groups .
#Text=The area was established in the 1660s and grew into a hub of paper and cotton manufacturing in the eighteenth century .
#Text=The extension of rail lines from Boston in the 1850s spurred the area 's residential development .
#Text=Hyde Park was once home to the first all African-American army unit , the 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment .
#Text=They assembled and trained at Camp Meigs in Readville .
#Text=The area would later briefly become a race track during dawn of the 20th century , before being used as an air combat testing facility during WWI .
#Text=Today it is a series of light industrial buildings near the Neponset river .
#Text=Mattapan
#Text=Historically a section of neighboring Dorchester , Mattapan became a part of Boston when Dorchester was annexed in 1870 .
#Text=Predominantly residential , Mattapan is a mix of public housing , triple deckers , and single-family homes .
#Text=Mattapan Square , where Blue Hill Avenue , River Street , and Cummins Highway meet , is the commercial heart of the neighborhood , home to banks , law offices , restaurants , and retail shops .
#Text=Mattapan now has the largest Haitian community in Massachusetts , and is also largely made up of African Americans and immigrants from other Caribbean countries .
#Text=Roslindale
#Text=Roslindale is a primarily residential neighborhood six miles southwest of downtown Boston .
#Text=Originally part of Roxbury , and after seceding in 1851 — the town then voted in 1873 to be annexed to the City of Boston .
#Text=Roslindale grew residentially as a classic streetcar suburb .
#Text=Railways were built after the American Civil War , which spawned a new round of commercial development .
#Text=In the 1920s , Roslindale Village took the shape it has today , with tree-lined Adams Park at its center .
#Text=That tree lined park surrounded by local businesses remains attractive to Bostonians in the 21st century .
#Text=This walkable area has become a haven for those priced out of JP and other areas affected by gentrification issues .
#Text=Even here prices have seen dramatic rises recently , and residents are working together to maintain the fabric of their community .
#Text=West Roxbury
#Text=Founded in 1630 , West Roxbury is nine miles from downtown Boston , and was originally used as farm land by the then independent town of Roxbury .
#Text=Seceding in 1851 , West Roxbury was annexed by Boston in 1874 .
#Text=Due to this quirk of history , it 's often confused with Roxbury , although the two are not connected and do n't share a border .
#Text=This neighborhood 's claim to fame is that it once played host to an experimental Utopian community during the mid 19th century .
#Text=Called Brook Farm , members ( like Nathaniel Hawthorne ) were inspired by the ideals of Transcendentalism , a religious and cultural philosophy based in New England .
#Text=Ultimately the experiment was financially unsuccessful , although many members looked back on their experience positively .
#Text=Unfortunately all buildings from this era have since been lost to fire , but the grounds are now a park and available for tours .
#Text=By car
#Text=The car is the premiere way to get around in these neighborhoods .
#Text=You will be further from the city center , so traffic and congestion will be ( comparatively ) less of an issue .
#Text=On street parking is cheap and easy to find .
#Text=Most attractions here are further apart and not well served by public transit .
#Text=While not necessary , a car will make your life easier while here .
#Text=By public transit
#Text=Forest Hills station on the Orange line in Roslindale is the only option for direct rapid transit into the city .
#Text=The next closest option is the Ashmont – Mattapan High Speed Line , a historic trolley and part of the Red line .
#Text=The last stop on this line serves Mattapan .
#Text=Used by locals daily , the current rolling stock was built at the end of WWII and is a tourist attraction for any train enthusiast .
#Text=Other than those two options , you 're going to need to ride the commuter rail .
#Text=For Hyde Park and Mattapan , take a train from South Station on the Fairmount , Franklin , or Providence/Stoughton lines .
#Text=For Roslindale or West Roxbury get on the Needham line , also from South Station .

#Text=The Parish of Christ Church , 1220 River St ( Hyde Park ) , ☏ +1617 361-2457 .
#Text=Historic French ’s Opera House ( Riverside Theatre Works ) , 45 Fairmount Ave ( Hyde Park ) , ☏ +1617 361-7024 .

#Text=Take in a festival , light lanterns , or visit the grave of E.E. Cummings in this 275 acre greenspace .

#Text=Do
#Text=George Wright Golf Course , 420 West Street ( Hyde Park ) , ☏ +1 617-364-2300 .
#Text=Named for baseball Hall of Famer and Cincinnati Reds shortstop George Wright .
#Text=The golf course is a Donald Ross-designed course and is considered one of his finest designs .
#Text=Chez Vous , 11 Rhoades St ( Mattapan , T : Morton Street ) , ☏ +1617 825-6877 .

#Text=Ron 's Gourmet Ice Cream and Twentieth Century Bowling Alley , 1231 Hyde Park Ave ( Hyde Park , T : Fairmount ) , ☏ +1617 364-5274 .
#Text=M - Th 7:30AM-10PM , F 7:30AM-11PM , Sa 8AM-11PM , Su 9AM-10PM .
#Text=Grab a cone , a rickey , and get in some candlepin bowling at this stalwart bastion of New England traditions .
#Text=Ice cream is made with high quality ingredients and can be enjoyed by connoisseurs .
#Text=Tons of kids in here all the time , so the staff knows how to handle them .
